page.title: 14JODRELL BANK RADIO TELESCOPE
page.content: The University of Manchester's Radio Observatory (part of which is in this block) offers an educational facility. The visitors centre, open to the public daily in summer and weekends in winter, has an exhibition of the latest{space techniques}and a {Planetarium,}set in 40 acres of parkland. Small children are excluded from the Planetarium and dogs of all sizes from the{Arboretum,}which contains more than 2000 types of shrubs and trees, both native British species and from other parts of the World, plus the national collections of flowering crab apple trees (Malus), rowans and whitebeam (Sorbus) The {Jodrell Bank Tree Society,}open to public membership exists to encourage development of the garden.
